meanings.definition: A group of mandarins or officials in a government or organization.
meanings.sent1: The mandarinate gathered to discuss the new policies.
meanings.sent2: The mandarinate held a meeting to address the issues at hand.
meanings.sent3: The mandarinate's annual picnic was a delightful event.
meanings.sent4: In the mandarinate of the school council, everyone had a specific role to play.
meanings.sent5: The mandarinate's unity was crucial for the organization's success.

meanings.definition: To govern or rule as a mandarin.
meanings.sent1: He aimed to mandarinate the province with fairness and justice.
meanings.sent2: The emperor decided to mandarinate the newly conquered territories.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to mandarinate the household chores.
meanings.sent4: The coach seemed to mandarinate the team with strict discipline.
meanings.sent5: The wise king knew how to mandarinate his kingdom wisely.

meanings.definition: The rank or status of a mandarin.
meanings.sent1: His mandarinate in the court granted him certain privileges.
meanings.sent2: She aspired to reach the highest mandarinate in the organization.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to claim the mandarinate of the house.
meanings.sent4: The mandarinate of the CEO was evident in his confident demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The mandarinate of the general was respected by all soldiers.
